New Records: Travis Head's 59 off 23 balls set the tone for Australia's 28-run win over England in the first T20I
Key Match Events: Travis Head's 59 off 23 balls set the tone for Australia's 28-run win over England in the first T20I
Adam Zampa's leggies choked up the middle overs and accounted for two wickets
Josh Hazlewood re-emerged to hit the stumps and make it 108 for six
Sam Curran caught Matt Short, and then took Josh Inglis's stumps with a slower ball
Josh Hazlewood ran in with his usual red-ball nip in the white-ball game to trouble Will Jacks and Cox's inside-edge
Pre-Game Insights: Phil Salt said 'They came out swinging, they came out hot. Fair play to Heady, he's had a great two years.'
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt said 'You've got to be very precise with where you're bowling at him, he's not very conventional, loses his front side very early, and creates a few different swing planes from a technical perspective.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The new-look England outfit was unable to make enough noise in response
Much has changed since the last time Australia's white-ball team visited England, during the lockdown summer of four years ago
Australia have since won two World Cups to become the short-form experts
Others: The match was played at the Utilita Bowl, with a winter-like chill in the evening air
Travis Head was compared to the 'Ahmedabad party-pooper'
